alert.note: Alert for Cook; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 06 at 8:38AM CDT until September 06 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOK AND CENTRAL WILL COUNTIES... At 838 AM CDT, doppler radar indicate rain has ended. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Runoff from that heavy rainfall is likely resulting in flash flooding of low lying and flood prone areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Joliet, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Romeoville, Calumet City, Chicago Heights, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Lockport, New Lenox, Homer Glen, Blue Island, Dolton, Park Forest, Homewood, Matteson, Mokena, Frankfort and Lemont. Local media reports indicate many viaducts flooded. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
